content:
As a digital AI assistant, I don't have personal preferences or physical needs, but I can certainly provide you with some suggestions for packing snacks for your trip!

Packing your own snacks can be a great way to save money and ensure you have healthy options available. Here are some ideas for snacks that are easy to pack and won't spoil easily:

1. Nuts and seeds: Almonds, cashews, pumpkin seeds, and sunflower seeds are all nutritious and filling.
2. Dried fruit: Dried apricots, cranberries, and raisins are sweet and chewy.
3. Energy bars: Look for bars with wholesome ingredients and minimal added sugars.
4. Jerky: Beef, turkey, or chicken jerky is a protein-packed snack that's easy to pack.
5. Granola: A small bag of homemade or store-bought granola can provide a quick energy boost.
6. Sandwiches: PB&Js are a classic, but you can also make small sandwiches with turkey, ham, or veggies.
7. Crackers and cheese: A small block of cheese and a pack of crackers can provide a satisfying snack.
8. Fresh fruit: Apples, oranges, bananas, and avocados are all easy to pack and won't spoil quickly.
9. Trail mix: A mix of nuts, seeds, and dried fruit is a tasty and healthy snack.
10. Energy-rich bites: Homemade or store-bought energy balls made with oats, nuts, and dried fruit are a great option.

Remember to pack your snacks in airtight containers or ziplock bags to keep them fresh and secure. And don't forget to check with your airline for any specific rules or restrictions on food and snacks.

I hope these ideas help you pack some delicious and convenient snacks for your trip!
